sen.j: 霊鹿山 行願寺（りょうろくざん ぎょうがんじ）は、京都府京都市中京区にある天台宗の寺院。
sen.e: Ryorokuzan Gyogan-ji Temple is a Tendai Sect temple located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ryorokuzan Gyogan-ji Temple is a Tendai Sect temple located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ryorokuzan Gyogan-ji Temple is a Tendai Sect temple located in Nakagyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Its principle image is the thousand-armed Cannon.
Its principle image is the thousand-armed Cannon.
Its principle image is the Thousand Armed Kannon (or Deity of Mercy).
sen.cmt: 「Cannon」→「Kannon」とし、「千手観音」の訳を他の記事とあわせました。

sen.e: The temple is commonly known as Kodo.
The temple is commonly known as Kodo.
The temple is commonly known as Kodo.

sen.j: 寛弘元年（1004年） 行円が一条通小川通の一条北辺堂跡に創建
sen.e: Gyogan-ji Temple was founded by Gyonen in 1004 on the ruins of Ichijo Hokuhendo at Ichijo-dori Street Ogawa-dori Street.
Gyogan-ji Temple was founded by Gyonen in 1004 on the ruins of Ichijo Hokuhendo at Ichijo-dori Street Ogawa-dori Street.
Gyogan-ji Temple was founded by Gyoen in 1004 on the ruins of Ichijo Hokuhendo Temple at Ogawa-dori Street, Ichijo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 「Gyonen」→「Gyoen」とし、住所表記を変更しました。

sen.j: 行円が鹿皮を身につけていた事から、革堂と呼ばれた。
sen.e: It became known as Kodo (lit. deerskin hall) due to the fact that Gyonen would wear deerskin.
It became known as Kodo (lit. deerskin hall) due to the fact that Gyonen would wear deerskin.
It became known as Kodo (lit. deerskin hall) due to the fact that Gyoen would wear deerskin.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期 焼失
sen.e: The temple was destroyed by fire at the beginning of the Edo period.
The temple was destroyed by fire at the beginning of the Edo period.
The temple was destroyed by fire at the beginning of the Edo period.

sen.j: 宝永5年（1708年） 現在地に移転
sen.e: It was then relocated to its current location in 1708.
It was then relocated to its current location in 1708.
It was then relocated to its current location in 1708.

tit.cmt: 配置ではないので、左記のとおり修正しました。

sen.j: 本堂 - 1815年、京都市指定有形文化財
sen.e: Main hall: Constructed in 1815 and designated a tangible cultural asset by Kyoto City.
Main hall: Constructed in 1815 and designated a tangible cultural asset by Kyoto City.
Main hall: Constructed in 1815 and designated a tangible cultural asset by Kyoto City.

sen.j: 鐘楼 - 1804年、京都市指定有形文化財
sen.e: Belfry: Constructed in 1804 and designated a tangible cultural asset by Kyoto City.
Belfry: Constructed in 1804 and designated a tangible cultural asset by Kyoto City.
Belfry: Constructed in 1804 and designated a tangible cultural asset by Kyoto City.

sen.j: 寿老人神堂 - 安土桃山時代
sen.e: Jurojin Shindo hall: Constructed during the Azuchi Momoyama Period.
Jurojin Shindo hall: Constructed during the Azuchi Momoyama Period.
Jurojin Shindo hall: Constructed during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: 「安土桃山時代」の訳を修正しました。

sen.e: Yurei Ema (a votive wooden tablet with an image of a ghost)
Yurei Ema (a votive wooden tablet with an image of a ghost)
Yurei Ema (a votive wooden tablet with an image of a ghost)
Pilgrimage Site
Pilgrimage Site
Pilgrimage Site

sen.j: 西国三十三箇所第十九番
sen.e: 19th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
19th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 19th of the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
sen.cmt: 「西国三十三箇所」の訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 18 頂法寺 -- 19 行願寺 -- 20 善峯寺
sen.e: 18. Choho-ji Temple; 19. Gyogan-ji Temple; 20. Yoshimine-dera Temple
18. Choho-ji Temple; 19. Gyogan-ji Temple; 20. Yoshimine-dera Temple
18. Choho-ji Temple; 19. Gyogan-ji Temple; 20. Yoshimine-dera Temple
Miyako Shichifukujin (Seven Gods of Good Fortune) (Rojujin)
Miyako Shichifukujin (Seven Gods of Good Fortune) (Rojujin)
Miyako Shichifukujin (Seven Gods of Good Fortune) (Rojujin (god of longevity))
sen.cmt: 「寿老人」の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 洛陽三十三所観音霊場第四番（千手観音）
sen.e: The fourth sacred place of the 33 temple Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage in Kyoto.
The fourth sacred place of the 33 temple Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage in Kyoto.
It is the 4th of the 33 sacred places that are visited during the Rakuyo Kannon Pilgrimage (the Thousand Armed Kannon).
sen.cmt: 「千手観音」訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 京都市中京区寺町通竹屋町通上ル行願寺門前町
sen.e: Monzennakamachi, Takeyamachi-dori agaru Teramachi-dori Street, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City
Monzennakamachi, Takeyamachi-dori agaru Teramachi-dori Street, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City
Monzen Nakamachi, Gyogan-ji, Takeyamachi-dori Street agaru, Teramachi-dori Street, Nakagyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City
sen.cmt: 「行願寺」訳、「-ku」を補足、順序を変えました。

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄丸太町駅 (京都市営地下鉄)より徒歩7分
sen.e: 7 minutes walk from Marutamachi Station (Kyoto City Subway) on the Kyoto City Subway.
7 minutes walk from Marutamachi Station (Kyoto City Subway) on the Kyoto City Subway.
7 minutes walk from Marutamachi Station (Kyoto City Subway) on the Kyoto City Subway.
sen.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。

sen.j: 京阪鴨東線丸太町駅 (京阪)より徒歩6分
sen.e: 6 minutes walk from Marutamachi Station (Keihan) on the Keihan Electric Railway Oto-Line.
6 minutes walk from Marutamachi Station (Keihan) on the Keihan Electric Railway Oto-Line.
6 minutes walk from Marutamachi Station (Keihan) on Oto-Line of the Keihan Electric Railway
sen.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。
